title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message:
The board has a history of water damage showed up very corroded in the top edge of the board. The backlight circuit was hit the hardest. After cleaning the board gets a green light and fan spin however there is no chime, RAM beeps, or light on USB mouse. The CPU gets slightly warm after being plugged in for a long time however does not immediately get boiling. I have all S0 rails except for CPU_VCORE.

PPBUS_G3H: 12.59v
COMPUTING_ISNS: 12.58v
PP5V_S0: 5.015v
PP3V3_S0: 3.297v
PP3V42_G3H: 3.475v
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.302v
PP1V8_S0: 1.799v
PP1V5_S0: 1.514v
PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: 0.904v
PP1V05_S0: 1.055v
PPVCORE_S0_CPU: 0v
PPVCORE_S0_AXG: 0v

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: CPUIMVP_VR_ON present? R7402 is ok? Voltage on R7402?

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message:
CPUIMVP_VR_ON: 3.293v

Resistance R7402: 91 K Ohms
Pin 1: 0.509v
Pin2: 12.58v

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: Crap under SMC/PCH. Replace clock chip and clean that corrosion up.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: The clock chip was replaced and the computer now POSTs and loads the OS. The backlight circuit which was hit the hardest with the corrosion is know a problem. The LVDS was replaced due to it missing legs. The LED backlight drive has been replaced as well as all the surrounding resistors (nasty looking) The through hole via for the LCDBKLT_PWR_SW had to be rebuilt, the feed back circuit is intact, I am not getting BKL_PWM (0v). I have tried PRAM resetting it SMC lid is 3.4v and I get 12.56v to the LVDS connector pin 21.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: Resistance to GND on PWM line?

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: Resistance to GND on BKL_PWM @ C9704 is 2.285M Ohms

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: Remove R9704 on tie BKL_PWM directly to 3V on see if backlight is back. If yes then PCH is bad and best to just leave it on full brightness like this.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: I injected 3 volts into pad 2 of where R9704 was and am still getting no backlight. Should I be looking at the LVDS for not telling the computer theres an LCD present or is it more likely a problem with the LED backlight driver not getting another rail it needs to be doing its job?

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: The 3v its being drawn at almost no amperage only 0.001 or 0.002 A.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: I assume you checked you have an image?

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: Im no longer getting video, looks like I need to check the LVDS area some more!

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: LCD_IG_PWR_EN is 0v, Its looking like the PCH is around every corner! Arghh.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: Diode mode on J9000 pin 4,6,7 without LCD connected. I assume you replaced that connector and cable.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message:
J9000
Pin 4: OL
Pin 6: 0.593v
Pin 7: 0.590v

I replaced the LVDS connector and am using a different test display.

title: 820-2936 Water Damage, Brain Dead!
message: You already gave the answer, which measurement seems wrong?
